title: AIML - Natural Language Platform Engineer, Siri and Information Intelligence
summary: Play a part in the next revolution in human-computer interaction. Contribute to a product that is redefining mobile computing. Create groundbreaking technology for large scale systems, spoken language, big data, and artificial intelligence. And work with the people who created the intelligent assistant that helps millions of people get things done — just by asking. Join the Siri Natural Language team at Apple.
description: The goal of the Siri Natural Language team is to take Siri to the next level of intelligence and accuracy in natural language understanding. You will design and implement low latency Siri NLU on-device. You should be passionate about taking machine learning model inference algorithms into production. Excellent communication skills will be required to coordinate work across multiple teams to resolve issues
key_qualifications:
Experience developing in C++ and/or Python
Experience building model release or validation pipelines is a plus
Experience with on-device development in Obj-C / Swift is a plus
Strong understanding of algorithms and software design
Experience working on CI/CD pipelines using job scheduling tools such as TeamCity or Jenkins
Strong communication skills to work well with cross-functional engineering teams
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with rapidly changing priorities
Experience with NLP or search engine is a plus
education_experience: Master’s degree in Computer Science or Bachelor's degree with 3+ years experience
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $115,731 and $204,000 annualized, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan.
